channel.title: Infrastructure Club Travel Guide
channel.description: Latest places added to the travel guide

item.title: “Alabama Hills” added in Lone Pine, United States
item.description: Surreal-seeming rock formations. Beautiful and (in summer) often extremely hot.

item.title: “Airworld Aviation Museum” added in Llanwnda, United Kingdom
item.description:
Located on the airfield of the former RAF Llandwrog, the museum has an impressive collection of aircraft and aviation memorabilia. The museum offers the opportunity to get close up to some historic aircraft. Set on an active airfield, the museum houses iconic machines such as the Hawker Hunter, D.H. Vampire, along with the only T2 BAe Harrier remaining worldwide.
Part of the museum is devoted to the creation of the RAF Mountain Rescue Service, started here at RAF Llandwrog in 1942, whilst other sections describe the wartime airfields of North Wales

item.title: “Airmail Navigation Arrow” added in Sandy Valley, United States
“Airbus UK Factory” added in Broughton, United Kingdom
item.description: Large 'Beluga' planes come in to land here to bring/take parts of planes away - can be viewed from anywhere near the runway. Very occasional tours.

item.title: “Airbus Factory Tours” added in Beauzelle, France
“Air Force Flight Test Museum” added in Edwards Air Force Base, United States
“Ailsa Craig” added in Girvan, United Kingdom
item.description: Quarried for curling stones, among other things https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ailsa_Craig#Curling_stones

item.title: “Afsluitdijk” added in Den Oever, Netherlands
item.description:
Enormous dam closing off the Netherlands from the North Sea. There's a road across it.
https://theafsluitdijk.com/

item.title: “Aerospace Bristol” added in Almondsbury, United Kingdom
item.description:
Aviation museum with lots of aircraft, other displays, and a Concorde.
https://aerospacebristol.org/

item.title: “Aeroplume flight in Grotte de la Samalandre” added in Barjac, France
item.description: Want to fly a one-person helium-filled airship inside a cave? You can.

item.title: “Aerial tram (lower terminal)” added in Portland, United States
item.description: A short but fun aerial tram, with good views. Unfortunately, there's not that much for a tourist to do on either end. Reasonably well connected to other transit, though.

item.title: “Acle Bridge” added in Acle, United Kingdom
item.description: Exceptionally low bridge, always good fun to watch boats going through

item.title: “Aberystwyth Cliff Railway” added in Aberystwyth, United Kingdom
“Abbotsbury Swannery” added in Chickerell, United Kingdom
“Abbey Pumping Station Museum” added in Belgrave, United Kingdom
“60 Hudson Street” added in Tribeca, United States
item.description: Formerly known as the Western Union Building. A major colocation center.

item.title: “33 Thomas Street / Long Lines building” added in New York City, United States
item.description: Windowless skyscraper containing major communication exchange points, and the likely location of an NSA intercept hub codenamed TITANPOINTE. https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/33_Thomas_Street

item.title: “228 Peace Memorial Park” added in Taipei, Taiwan
item.description: has some old steam trains

item.title: “مطار. اك الملح‎” added in Rumāh, Yemen
item.description: www.wired.com/dangerroom/2013/02/secret-drone-base-2/

item.title: “Πολυχώρος Πολιτισμού "Ισλαχανέ"” added in Ágios Pávlos, Greece
item.description: Old technical museum. Lovely stuff.

item.title: “Μουσείο Μαρμαροτεχνίας” added in Tínos, Greece
“港の散歩道” added in Nagasaki, Japan
item.description: Lookout point and large orange sphere. Cool to quickly look around. Added by Ed

item.title: “President Heads” added in Williamsburg, United States
“Tomakomai West Port Ferry Terminal” added in Tomakomai, Japan
item.description: Overnight ferry to sendai available, pain to book, but you can get a bedroom or pod, and can get a public bath on a moving ship.

item.title: “Snow Festival” added in Sapporo, Japan
item.description: During February each year the park is taken over by huge snow carvings/statues.

item.title: “Sapporo TV Tower” added in Sapporo, Japan
item.description: TV tower you can go up, has a mascot known as teli-dad https://yurukyara.fandom.com/wiki/Terebi_To-san

item.title: “Heavy Load-bearing Body” added in Schöneberg, Germany
item.description: The Heavy Load-bearing Body is a giant concrete structure built to test how much load the ground in Berlin could hold to help with the Nazi plan to build a great big arch. It is quite a strange, squat concrete tower on an unassuming corner. Visiting hours are seasonal (April - October) and they do guided tours every first Sunday of the month. Entry is free. https://www.schwerbelastungskoerper.de/the-heavy-load-bearing-body.html

item.title: “Avala Tower” added in Zuce, Serbia
item.description: Enormous brutalist concrete TV tower in the shape of a tripod. Destroyed in 1999, rebuilt in 2010.

item.title: “Mark IV British tank” added in Ashford, United Kingdom
item.description: Only one of a few that still exist, spent part of it's life housing a power transformer for the town.

item.title: “The Royal and Ancient Polar Bear Society” added in Hammerfest, Norway
item.description: The annual meeting of the society is held on the third Sunday in January every year at 18.00 in the Polar Bear Society. All members are welcome.

item.title: “Berlin Tunnel Tours” added in Gesundbrunnen, Germany
item.description: A company that offers a selection of tours of various tunnels / underground infra across Berlin. Includes tours of the tunnels used to cross between East/West Berlin, a flooded bunker, a Nazi Flak Tower, old UBahn stations, and more. (Tours leave from various locations so worth checking ahead.)

item.title: “Richard Montgomery Exclusion Zone” added in Sheerness, United Kingdom
item.description:
Here lies the Richard Montgomery, loaded with 7230 unexploded bombs. Do not go here.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SS_Richard_Montgomery

item.title: “Rotterdam Maritime Museum” added in Rotterdam, Netherlands
“Tenterden Kent” added in Tenterden, United Kingdom
item.description: Heritage railway running to Bodiam, a mix of steam and diesel. Has a full set of Pullman dining cars which are sometimes run for meals.

item.title: “Middleton Railway” added in Leeds, United Kingdom
item.description: Heritage railway, short track, with long history. Started in 1758

item.title: “Mining Museum Landek Park” added in Ludgeřovice, Czech Republic
item.description: Mining museum, plus the chance to go down in a mine cage about 2m below the surface to see some mine shafts. also you can ride a above ground mine rail

item.title: “Ostrava firefighter museum” added in Ostrava, Czech Republic
item.description: Small museum where you can see some old fire engines and such

item.title: “Bolt Tower” added in Ostrava, Czech Republic
item.description: Old Blast furnace various tours you can do in a hard hat and hard hat. Plus you can go to the top of one of the blast furnaces which has a nice view. Be aware they do tours but I had some issue that even though they advertise them in english the tour it self was not. so check first.

item.title: “Michal mine” added in Rychvald, Czech Republic
item.description: Access is via guided tour only. it's in Czech but you get an english audio tour. can see the old offices, changing rooms, and some other stuff

item.title: “Silesian Ostrava Castle” added in Ostrava, Czech Republic
item.description: It's a small rebuilt castle. Due to mining sustenance it's about 11m lower then it was when originally built

item.title: “Halda Ema” added in Ostrava, Czech Republic
item.description: Old mining waste heap that is 1000c inside so be careful if you go to the top

item.title: “Bunkr Přáslavice” added in Hlubočky, Czech Republic
item.description: Cold war bunker housing a telephone exchange. built halfway into a hill. has some massive generators on springs. Access via tour only

item.title: “Ascensore Castello D’Albertis - Montegalletto” added in Genoa, Italy
item.description: A hybrid lift/funicular that transitions between the two half way through the journey. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ascensore_Castello_d%27Albertis-Montegalletto

item.title: “Chiatura” added in Chiat’ura, Georgia
item.description: Chiatura, an old mining city known for it's extensive cable car system that was installed to transport workers around the valley and up to the mines. I will add some stuff I found intresting to the map but 99% of the stuff I found was from this site: https://wander-lush.org/kutaisi-to-chiatura/

item.title: “Sanatorium cable car station” added in Chiat’ura, Georgia
“Central Cable Car Station” added in Chiat’ura, Georgia
item.description: The main Cable car station. I would recomend getting the cable car to Sanatorium cable car station as that has the best views. each journey is about 5p and can you can use card to pay

item.title: “Old cable car station” added in Chiat’ura, Georgia
item.description: The only remaining original style cable car. free to use

item.title: “დიდი ტრაქტორი (Big Tractor)” added in Chiat’ura, Georgia
item.description: An large decaying tractor and truck

item.title: “Old train station and trains” added in Chiat’ura, Georgia
item.description: A decaying train station with a large number of old trains slowly rusting away.

item.title: “Telesférico histórico de Chiatura” added in Chiat’ura, Georgia
